channel.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
channel.description:
Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
I am, and I'm doing the practice PSAT or the PPSAT (lol) and for me the reading is hard cause the words are just so confusing. I wish I had a bigger vocab. By the way, if you're a Junior in HighSchool and you score a high score in the PSATs you're elligable for a scholarship. Full or partial scholarship depending on how well you do.
Last year when I took the PSATs I got a 88 on the Math, a 12 on the reading, and a 18 on the other one, I forget. This is so horrible lol.

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“David, post:27, topic:19012”]Damn Americans and your easy education systems.

I’d like you to take a look at the British, or at least, English education… >.<[/quote]
Your English system is also not even close to the intensity of the Indian/Japanse/Korean education systems…does that make yours easy too? From what I understand from a lot of family who grew up in England, the education system has definitely not kept up to its standards from about 30ish years ago, but I have to agree in general it is better than the American system.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“David, post:27, topic:19012”]Damn Americans and your easy education systems.

I’d like you to take a look at the British, or at least, English education… >.<[/quote]

Are you talking about the GCSE? I took the PSAT but I am going back to England this summer to take the GCSE. They are going to be hard. I got to study, my parents bought me a study book from over there so I could prepare myself. My cousin in England got really good grades on the GCSE, a lot of A Stars or something like that, and now he goes to Oxford University.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Btw, you don’t lose points for skipping questions.

+1 point for correct answers
+0 point for blank
-.25 point for wrong answer

Even though you don’t lose points, its recommended that you guess if you can eliminate at least one…chances are you will then get 1/4 right and even out your score regardless, but if you know the material you’ll do better. I dunno, the SAT is the stupidest test imho…I’m good with my score so I’m glad I don’t have to take it again.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:21, topic:19012”]I skipped 37 questions, so I only answered the ones I was about 95% sure of. That way I should have a much better score.

37*(1/4) = a little over 9 points. So I only lost 9 points for the ones I didn’t answer, I hope I got a better score! How did you guys do?

I skipped 4 math questions. For some reason, I day dreamed during the test. I was wondering what people would do if someone just came in the room, and shot someone. Then I thought, what if they shot me. And it would just go on lol, and I ran out of time. :rolleyes:[/quote]

Tell me if it works out, seems a good idea.

Read full topic

item.source: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

Ron go to Barnes & Nobles, I bought this SAT Vocabulary Book, around 800 words that will highly improve your chance of getting a high score on English, its around 26 USD, do about 20 per day and memorize them, it has a great technique because it shows the word on the frontpage and the def on the back so you can estimate what it means and then really look it up. I learned some really interesting words that happened to come on my PSAT

Good Luck and Try Hard!

BTW Add me in MSN, I might come one today and I do remember some of the test, I’ll tell it to you and maybe if your luck works out it will be the same test

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I know an SAT word… “frivolous”
I was scanning through this one asians 800 page SAT prep book, and i saw it. I thought it was a funny word so now I use it in my everyday vocabulary Im bound to get that one right…Now i just have to hope it shows up on my test

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Bobdole, 88 was the percentage. And I’m holding it right in my hand reading the number I got. I scored pretty high on that, but I made some dumb mistakes. I always screw up on probability. Not this year though!

I hope it’s as easy as you say it is VG, cause when I took it last year I screwed up. Also, I answered the questions I didn’t know lol, so I didn’t get the 1/4 off, but I got 1 point taken down. I screwed myself on that part.

Yeah guesssing C does not work any more because the Letters are all computer generated now. And you have 5 choices per, so it’s a 20% chance you will get it right.

And thanks for the luck Bullzeye, I hope I do good on this test. Actually, I hope I do superb, cause good is not good enough to get a scholarship.

exps, yeah I don’t know why I do so bad on reading. I read a good amount at home like fiction novels, and I build my vocab, but they ask me words that are obscure even to Webster himself. It bamboozles me, why can’t they ask questions with the word bamboozle lol, I know that one!

If anyone took notes or memorized any questions, that would be very helpful! I’ll study real hard, thanks for the support.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

dont stress too much over the sats stressing and beating yourself up only causes you to fail remember to choose c if you dont know the answer, you shouldnt have too much trouble though if you have had a standardised state testing for example the Fcats think of it as a long verion of that

You are penilized for wrong answers on the SAT by 1/4 a point… it would be stupid to guess C.

And the FCAT is easy as hell (I assume you live in FL and we’re talking about the same test?)

Read full topic

item.description:
@Teh_Freak wrote:

i hated the psat, its not much like the sat, its easy as shit in comparison i think, i did better on the psat, but i tried so much harder, i got 1890 on the sat, and like 1780 on the psat, so idk, i gotta take it nov 4th and the one in december. but shit, if you do good on the psat you can get scholarships and shit so try hard i guess.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I cant make it to ppsat’s this saturday because I have a big race at mt. san antonio college. Im going to take the regular psats in the spring.

And psat was origionally meant to just be practice for the SATs so the little asian boys could over-acheive, but it eventually evolved into a competition :P. Im pretty sure you can get up to a $2500 scholarship, but only if you do extremely well and are high up in the rankings. And you pretty much have 4 years to practice for these things (Although i havent taken any yet), So by senior year you should be getting at least better than a 12 on reading
Good luck Ron

Read full topic

im with bullzeye but im in eight grade

item.source: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Ron:

Last year when I took the PSATs I got a 88 on the Math, a 12 on the reading, and a 18 on the other one, I forget. This is so horrible lol.

You do realize that the maximum you can get is 80 in each category? So I’d love to know how you got 88

Imo, your best bet for math is just to do a bunch of practice problems…make sure you know how to solve each type of problem the moment you see it. Getting the answer isn’t the hardest part, its figuring out what to do for each question in the time you have. For critical reading…do a ton of vocab (the part of the SATs I hated the most by far). i don’t have any tips for writing

And don’t worry about it too much. Even if you do make the top few in the NMSQT, you can only get like a 2000 dollar scholorship from them or something (from what I’ve heard). One advantage of it though is a lot of colleges recognize it…I got through like one of the first coupld rounds just with my psat grade, and got a ton of really unknown colleges offering me full scholorship because of my psat scores…don’t think i’m applying to any of them though. But yeah, you don’t get that much for getting a great score.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?

item.description:

item.title: Anyone taking the PSATs this Saturday?
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

I took the SAT last saturday. It lasted from 7:45 - 1:00, and you get two 5 minute breaks. It’s a pain in the ass.

Oh and when you register for the SAT @ collegeboard.com, use a secondary email or something because they send so much spam. I get like literally 5-10 pointless messages a day from them reminding me to register for the next SAT, etc.

Read full topic
